sense.name: mountaintop
sense.commentary: peak, crown, crest, top, tip - the top point of a mountain or hill
sense.examples: The view from the summit was magnificent. They clambered to the summit of Monadnock.

sense.name: high degree
sense.commentary: acme, height, elevation, pinnacle, superlative, top - the highest level or degree attainable
sense.examples: His landscapes were deemed the summit of beauty. The artist's gifts are at their summit. At the summit of her career she was a mediocre waitress at best. The summit of his ambition led John to jog a whole city block.

sense.name: meeting
sense.commentary: SUMMIT[+event] summit meeting - a meeting of heads of governments
sense.examples: The summit will be held in the Capital Building on Friday at 4pm. They will report on the summit tomorrow.
